content.p: Suppose a ladder of length {{ladderlength}} ft is leaning against a wall. Then the base of the ladder is pulled away from the wall at a rate of {{velocityx}} feet/second. What is the velocity of the top of the ladder when the base of the ladder is {{distancex}} feet away from the wall?

Suppose an oil spill in the ocean formed a circle and was growing at a rate of {{dadt}} feet^2/minute. When the oil slick reaches a radius of {{radius}}, how fast is the radius of the oil spill growing?

Suppose a person who was {{heightperson}} feet tall was standing between a light on the ground and a wall. They are {{disttolight}} feet away from the light and {{disttowall}} feet away from the wall. If they start walking torwards the {{persondirection}} at a speed of {{personspeed}} feet/second, how fast would the height of the shadow they cast change and in what direction?

Suppose a car was {{d1}} miles east of a town, traveling {{direction1}} at {{s1}} mph. A second car was {{d2}} miles north of the same town, traveling {{direction2}} at {{s2}} mph. At this exact moment, how fast is the distance between the cars changing?
